alert.note: Alert for Chester; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chester and southern York Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 913 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Indian Land to 13 miles southwest of York. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Rock Hill, Lesslie, Fort Lawn, Mcconnells, Richburg, Lowrys, Chester State Park, Catawba and Fishing Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
